title: The Shroud was the Resurrection?
post: The fact that M. Annette Cloutier relies on James Tabor for biblical studies only shows that she is wide off the mark.
author: Louis

title: The Shroud was the Resurrection?
post: There will be no end to these such fantasies so long as there are those who are dependent upon them. Most people, though, will see them for what they are.
author: Chris

title: The Shroud was the Resurrection?
post: Must add that this is just a part of a much wider movement, agenda-driven of course, and filled with people who share one particular view of the New Testament that suits their worldview. The approach is such that if the Old Testament comes under close scrutiny dozens of myths will be found and that is the reason why nothing is said about this part of the Bible. No one needs to be like Arnold Toynbee to grasp this.
author: Louis
